intro: Dianthus nicolai, commonly known as the Nicolai carnation, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers with frilled petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces clusters of blooms in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are linear and slightly hairy, and it prefers well-drained soil and full sun. Dianthus nicolai is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and floral arrangements.
